title: Robot
facts: Robot (Enthiran) was one of the most expensive Indian films during its release, featuring advanced special effects for its time.
The film marked the first collaboration between superstar Rajinikanth and director Shankar.
It was released in multiple languages and became a significant success across India.

title: Kites
facts: Kites was notable for its crossover appeal, featuring Hrithik Roshan and Mexican actress Barbara Mori in the lead roles.
The movie was shot in both English and Hindi languages to cater to a wider international audience.
Director Anurag Basu crafted the film with a unique narrative style, drawing attention for its visual treatment.

title: Delhi 6
facts: The movie's title 'Delhi 6' refers to the postal index code of the area in Old Delhi.
Director Rakeysh Omprakash Mehra drew inspiration from his own experiences growing up in the Chandni Chowk area of Delhi.
A.R. Rahman's music for the film received critical acclaim and added to its appeal.

title: Toilet Ek Prem Katha
facts: The film highlighted the importance of sanitation and aimed to raise awareness about the issue of open defecation in India.
It was inspired by the true story of a woman who left her husband due to the lack of a toilet in their home.
Akshay Kumar, known for his socially relevant roles, played a pivotal part in this film.

title: Dangal
facts: Dangal is based on the real-life story of wrestler Mahavir Singh Phogat and his daughters Geeta Phogat and Babita Kumari.
Aamir Khan, who portrayed the role of Mahavir Singh Phogat, underwent a dramatic physical transformation for the film.
The movie received widespread acclaim for its portrayal of female empowerment through sports.

title: Ek Tha Tiger
facts: Ek Tha Tiger marked the first installment in the successful spy thriller series featuring Salman Khan and Katrina Kaif.
The film was shot in multiple international locations, adding to its visual appeal and scale.
It became one of the highest-grossing Bollywood films of 2012.

title: Chak De India
facts: Chak De India centered around women's field hockey and emphasized the importance of unity and sportsmanship.
Shah Rukh Khan's performance as the coach of the Indian women's hockey team received widespread acclaim.
The movie inspired and brought attention to women's sports in India.

title: Rocket Singh
facts: Rocket Singh: Salesman of the year portrayed a different aspect of business life, focusing on ethical practices in sales.
Ranbir Kapoor's performance as a struggling salesman earned appreciation from critics.
The film was praised for its realistic portrayal of the corporate world.

title: Gunjan Saxena: The Kargil Girl
facts: The movie is based on the life of Gunjan Saxena, one of India's first female combat aviators.
Janhvi Kapoor portrayed the titular role of Gunjan Saxena and received praise for her performance.
It shed light on gender bias and challenges faced by women in the Indian Air Force.

title: Tubelight
facts: Tubelight was directed by Kabir Khan and featured Salman Khan in a heartwarming role.
The film explored the themes of love, acceptance, and the impact of war on families.
It marked the Bollywood debut of Chinese actress Zhu Zhu.

title: Devdas
facts: Devdas is based on the novel of the same name by Sarat Chandra Chattopadhyay and has been adapted multiple times in Indian cinema.
The film starring Shah Rukh Khan, Aishwarya Rai, and Madhuri Dixit was noted for its grand sets and visual opulence.
It received critical acclaim for its performances and tragic storyline.

title: Manjhi The Mountain Man
facts: Manjhi: The Mountain Man is a biographical film based on the life of Dashrath Manjhi, who carved a path through a mountain.
Nawazuddin Siddiqui portrayed the lead role of Dashrath Manjhi and received accolades for his performance.
The movie highlighted the determination and struggle of an individual against all odds.

title: Singh Is Kinng
facts: Singh Is Kinng was a comedy-drama featuring Akshay Kumar in the lead role as Happy Singh.
The film's soundtrack became highly popular, especially the song 'Teri Ore' sung by Rahat Fateh Ali Khan.
It was filmed in various international locations, adding to its visual appeal.

title: Talvar
facts: Talvar is based on the controversial Noida double murder case, known as the Aarushi-Hemraj murder case.
The film presented multiple perspectives on the case, leaving the audience to draw their own conclusions.
It received acclaim for its realistic portrayal and the performances of its cast.

title: Lagaan: Once Upon a Time in India
facts: Lagaan was nominated for the Academy Award for Best Foreign Language Film, representing India.
The movie, set in the British colonial era, depicted a fictional cricket match between villagers and the British.
Aamir Khan not only starred in the film but also produced it, and it became a massive success both in India and internationally.

title: Dhoom
facts: Dhoom marked the beginning of a successful action film franchise known for its stylish heists and thrilling sequences.
The movie popularized the 'Dhoom Machale' song and showcased high-speed bike chases.
It featured Abhishek Bachchan as a cop and John Abraham as a stylish thief.

title: Badhaai Ho
facts: Badhaai Ho dealt with a unique storyline where an older couple unexpectedly finds out they are expecting a child.
The film challenged societal norms and received praise for its humor and sensitive portrayal of the situation.
Ayushmann Khurrana played a significant role in this unconventional yet successful film.

title: Bheja Fry
facts: Bheja Fry is a comedy film that was a remake of a French film 'Le DÃ®ner de Cons' (The Dinner Game).
The movie received positive reviews for its humor and Rajat Kapoor's performance.
Despite being made on a low budget, it garnered appreciation for its witty storytelling.

title: No Entry
facts: No Entry is a comedy film known for its entertaining storyline about extramarital affairs and mistaken identities.
The movie boasted a star-studded cast including Salman Khan, Anil Kapoor, Fardeen Khan, and others.
It became a commercial success and is remembered for its catchy music.

title: Aankhen
facts: Aankhen is a heist thriller that featured Amitabh Bachchan, Akshay Kumar, Arjun Rampal, and Paresh Rawal in prominent roles.
The film centered around a plan to rob a bank and showcased the blind characters executing the heist.
It was praised for its intriguing plot and the performances of the ensemble cast.

title: Bala
facts: Bala addressed the societal stigma around premature balding and self-acceptance.
Ayushmann Khurrana played the role of a young man struggling with premature baldness.
The film received appreciation for its humor and for shedding light on a sensitive topic.

title: Mary Kom
facts: Mary Kom is a biographical sports drama based on the life of boxer MC Mary Kom.
Priyanka Chopra portrayed the titular role and underwent intense physical training to prepare for the character.
The movie highlighted Mary Kom's journey from a small village to becoming a world champion.

title: Ek Chalis Ki Last Local
facts: Ek Chalis Ki Last Local is a dark comedy thriller that takes place over one night in Mumbai.
The movie follows the misadventures of two strangers who miss their last train and encounter unexpected situations.
It gained a cult following for its unique storyline and unconventional narrative.

title: Guzaarish
facts: Guzaarish is a drama that delves into the story of a paralyzed magician seeking the right to end his life.
The film marked the collaboration of director Sanjay Leela Bhansali and actors Hrithik Roshan and Aishwarya Rai.
It received critical acclaim for its performances and emotional depth.

title: Andhadhun
facts: Andhadhun is a black comedy thriller that revolves around a blind pianist entangled in a web of mysteries.
The film received widespread acclaim for its intriguing plot and unexpected twists.
Ayushmann Khurrana's portrayal and the movie's narrative were highly praised.

title: Koiâ€¦ Mil Gaya
facts: Koi... Mil Gaya is a sci-fi film that narrates the story of a mentally challenged young man who befriends an extraterrestrial being.
Hrithik Roshan played the lead role and received acclaim for his performance as a character with special needs.
The film was a commercial success and spawned sequels.

title: Mission Mangal
facts: Mission Mangal is based on the true story of India's Mars Orbiter Mission (Mangalyaan) launched by ISRO.
The film celebrated the contribution of female scientists in the mission and their role in making it successful.
It received praise for its portrayal of scientific achievements in an accessible manner.

title: Secret Superstar
facts: Secret Superstar revolves around a young girl who aspires to be a singer and becomes an internet sensation anonymously.
Aamir Khan played an important supporting role in the film and also produced it.
The movie received acclaim for its heartwarming story and performances.

title: Rocketry: The Nambi Effect
facts: Rocketry: The Nambi Effect is a biographical film based on the life of Indian aerospace engineer Nambi Narayanan.
R Madhavan not only acted in the lead role but also directed and produced the film.
The movie sheds light on Nambi Narayanan's wrongful espionage case and his contributions to India's space program.

title: Super 30
facts: Super 30 is inspired by the life of mathematician Anand Kumar, who runs a program to coach economically disadvantaged students for the IIT entrance exams.
Hrithik Roshan portrayed Anand Kumar and underwent a significant transformation for the role.
The film highlighted the importance of education and equal opportunities.

title: Dil To Pagal Hai
facts: Dil To Pagal Hai is a romantic musical film known for its catchy music and dance sequences.
The film starred Shah Rukh Khan, Madhuri Dixit, and Karisma Kapoor in lead roles.
It received accolades for its vibrant choreography and became a commercial success.

title: Delhi Belly
facts: Delhi Belly is a black comedy that revolves around a group of friends caught in a bizarre sequence of events after one of them gets involved with smugglers.
The film was noted for its edgy humor and unconventional storyline.
It was produced by Aamir Khan and gained attention for its bold content.

title: One 2 Ka 4
facts: One 2 Ka 4 is an action-comedy film featuring Shah Rukh Khan as a cop paired with Juhi Chawla.
The movie's soundtrack composed by A.R. Rahman was well-received, especially the title track.
It combined elements of comedy, drama, and action, showcasing Shah Rukh Khan's versatility.

title: Article 15
facts: Article 15 addressed social issues and caste-based discrimination prevalent in Indian society.
Ayushmann Khurrana portrayed the role of a police officer investigating a rural murder case.
The movie received acclaim for its bold approach and thought-provoking narrative.

title: Taxi No. 9211
facts: Taxi No. 9211 is a dramedy focusing on the clash between two individuals with contrasting personalities inside a taxi.
The film starred Nana Patekar and John Abraham in pivotal roles.
It explored themes of human nature and life's complexities within a confined space.

title: Rockstar
facts: Rockstar is a musical drama that follows the journey of a musician and his tumultuous love life.
Ranbir Kapoor played the lead role and received praise for his portrayal of a passionate yet troubled musician.
The film's soundtrack composed by A.R. Rahman was a massive hit and added to its popularity.

title: Singham
facts: Singham is an action film known for its high-octane sequences and Ajay Devgn's portrayal of a tough cop.
The movie was a remake of a Tamil film and became a successful franchise.
It showcased the fight against corruption and earned acclaim for its action-packed narrative.

title: Jo Jeeta Wohi Sikandar
facts: Jo Jeeta Wohi Sikandar is a coming-of-age sports drama revolving around a cycling competition.
The film starred Aamir Khan in a leading role and featured memorable songs.
It received praise for its realistic portrayal of teenage aspirations and rivalries.
